ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .

The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.

Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Chad's a man of great knowledge. I think students would get more out of the class however if it were structured around a real world project of which Chad knows man candidates.
I really enjoyed the homework assignments in this class and felt that I learned the most from doing them. I wish the lectures were a bit more structured and organized.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: professor very knowledgeable and made it very interesting the format in which he shared
i learned the most from doing things by myself i.e. the assignments are well designed to let a student learn by doing things.

The projects. The course included 5 major group projects, with the option to complete the projects individually. The projects were large and challenging, with one project at each of five major levels of management. Having to plunge in to work out what one would to in a real-world management project at the Operations Implementation, Operations Planning and Oversight, Tactical, Strategic and Policy level was invaluable. Discussing the problems with others, pooling background knowledge and looking for answers together (including seeking instructor support) was a productive and skill-building way to practice management. The opportunity to use the Toggle program to plan for the best combination of sustainabilities in forestry work, relative to chosen values, was excellent. Overall the course was a great overview to resources management. Professor Oliver has worked in the field for a long time and is himself a wealth of knowledge and experience.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: too many homework assignments, Seems often to be busy work
Inclusion of other resources than forest.

The initial project, at the Operations level, was a very large one. It could perhaps be divided into two submissions, to allow a smoother start to the semester. In-class discussion of each of the levels of management presented could include more depth and breadth. I say this somewhat tentatively though, because other material presented is also valuable, and I am hard-pressed to say what should be sacrifices.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: fewer homework assignments. Better references on V2 applicable to discussion
Very good.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: i am BSc student and i work for the government in the field of environment. My nature of job requires a very strong background in resource management. Hence, the course is relevant for me.
The course fits well. One aspect I am developing in my program is a global overview of the Earth's resources and how they are used, protected, managed, planned and so on.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I work for the government in the field of environment. My nature of job requires a very strong background in resource management. Hence, the course is relevant for me.
I took the course because I will work with the world's natural resources, and I am gathering as much information and experience as I can about doing so.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: very good course, learned alot
Yes.

Yes, they did. While I would like more details of the nitty-gritty of management, but I think that will come with internships, practica and field courses, job training, mentorships, and so on, I am not sure it should have come from a classroom course. The five major projects were well designed to be challenging, yet do-able. I am a more knowledgeable person now, with some management skills in development and a great overview of both the big picture of managing forests and many of the details of a variety of levels of management.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantage I actually learned the most by working on the assignment with my group friends.

The projects were the heart of the course. We had the option to work in pairs, groups or alone, and these were able to shift from project to project as needed, so I think one found one's advantage or disadvantage and adjusted accordingly. I found working with others to be a positive experience to determine how to approach a project, to pool knowledge and to learn together. Some of this learning came in working on a project and some came in sharing the projects in class.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It is a very good course. It covers the basic but very important skills and ideas that would require for a good resource manager.
worth taking the courses as the group exercise gives you an insights.

If you will be working as a resources manager, as many of us will, strongly consider including this course in your course selection. Professor Oliver has a wealth of knowledge and experience, and he works well with work groups and individual students, supporting at every turn as requested. The projects are challenging, very satisfying to complete. The course gives a solid overview of the scope of managing resources, with a focus on forestry. Be prepared to start the projects as soon as you can and to put in significant time on them. Strongly consider working in pairs or small groups.
